sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"增加，增大"或"扩大"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: enlarge, amplify, expand, increase, magnify, multiply, augment
means: enlarge ： 主要指面积或体积等的扩大。
amplify ： 在科技中常指声音的扩大或电磁波的增强。也指补充了细节、详述或扩大内容等。此词系正式用语。
expand ： 指范围、程度、体积和尺寸等方面的扩大或增加。
increase ： 指数量、强度和大小等方面的扩大或增加。
magnify ： 可指用光学仪器使物体看上去显得变大；也指事实上把某物增大，有时用于夸张意味。
multiply ： 通常指自然繁殖而产生的增长，有时也指同类事物数量的成倍增加。
augment ： 较正式用词，一般指在原有的基础上增加含量而扩大。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均有"夸大，夸张"之意。
means: exaggerate ： 指有意或无意地夸张或夸大，含强烈"过火"意味。
magnify ： 本义为"放大或扩大"，引申用与exaggerate含义类似，但不如exaggerate常用。

word_mean: 放大：用透镜或适当镜片使物体的外观变大

sentence.Network_en: He tried to magnify the part he played in the battle.
sentence.Network_cn: 他试图夸大他在战斗中发挥的作用.

sentence.Network_en: My soul does magnify the Lord.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的心确实是赞美上帝的.
望远镜和显微镜能放大.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the senses 'show honour to (God') and 'make greater in size or importance'): from Old French magnifier or Latin magnificare, based on Latin magnus 'great'. Sense 1 dates from the mid 17th cent

entry.def: To magnify an object means to make it appear larger than it really is, by means of a special lens or mirror.

example.ex: This version of the Digges telescope magnifies images 11 times...
example.tran: 这种型号的迪格斯望远镜可将图像放大11倍。

example.ex: A lens would magnify the picture so it would be like looking at a large TV screen.
example.tran: 透镜会把图片放大，就像在看巨大的电视屏幕一样。

entry.def: To magnify something means to increase its effect, size, loudness, or intensity.

example.ex: Poverty and human folly magnify natural disasters...
example.tran: 贫困和人类的愚昧加剧了自然灾难。

example.ex: Their noises were magnified in the still, wet air.
example.tran: 他们的喧闹声在凝滞而潮湿的空气中显得更吵了。

entry.def: If you magnify something, you make it seem more important or serious than it really is.

example.ex: They do not grasp the broad situation and spend their time magnifying ridiculous details...
example.tran: 他们不去把握大局，而是在细枝末节上花费时间大做文章。

example.ex: Any signs of discontent tend to be magnified and overanalyzed.
example.tran: 稍有不满便会被上纲上线。

means.word_mean: 1. increase in size, volume or significance;

sentences.sentence: "Her terror was magnified in her mind"

means.word_mean: 2. to enlarge beyond bounds or the truth;

sentences.sentence: "tended to romanticize and exaggerate this `gracious Old South' imagery"

auth_sentence.content: In good times, it can magnify a fund's gains.

sentences.en: A microscope magnifies bacteria so that they can be seen and studied.

sentences.cn: 我的心确实是赞美上帝的。

jushi.english: This is a microscope that magnifies greatly.
jushi.chinese: 这是台放大很多倍的显微镜。

jushi.english: This photograph won't probably magnify well.
jushi.chinese: 这张照片放大出来很可能效果不好。
